dialogue: Hello, son.
-sigh- You're not my mother, Quinn.
Yeah, I was just trying it on. Now that I've said it, I think you’re right.
Good! That was starting to get a little weird, man.
I definitely feel like a man. How about you?
Yes, Quinn. I also feel like a man.
If you want to, you can call me Dad.
Not gonna do that.
Right, right. I like to think of myself more as a the kind of cool Dad whose kids call him by his first name.
No! You're not my Dad!
Yet.
...what do you mean “yet”??
Well, your mother always liked me.
Quinn, you can't date my Mom.
It's okay, Steve. It’s always difficult when a parent remarries. I just hope that in time, we can build a strong father-son relationship.
My mother is still married! To my Dad!
So you'll have two Dads! And best of all: one of them will be me!
I'm gonna go.
Goodbye, son.
Hmm, nope. Still feels weird. Maybe I won't marry Steve’s mom after all.
